revised_title: Insular Fauna and Flora: Origins and Relationships in the Southern Cold Temperate Zone
tldr: This article discusses the origins and relationships of insular faunas in the southern cold temperate zone, focusing on the importance of studying the interdependence of animal and plant ecology. The authors explore the potential for discovering new species and understanding the age of arthropod faunas in isolated regions, as well as the impact of human intervention on these ecosystems.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Evolution
